meanings.definition: To throw (someone) out of a window.
meanings.sent1: The villain tried to defenestrate the hero from the top floor.
meanings.sent2: Please do not defenestrate any objects from the building.
meanings.sent3: The cat accidentally defenestrated the vase while chasing a mouse.
meanings.sent4: The storm's strong winds seemed to defenestrate everything in their path.
meanings.sent5: The idea of defenestration in movies always makes me nervous.

meanings.definition: To remove or expel (someone) from a position of power or authority.
meanings.sent1: The board decided to defenestrate the CEO due to financial mismanagement.
meanings.sent2: It is not easy to defenestrate a long-standing leader without repercussions.
meanings.sent3: The students jokingly planned to defenestrate the teacher from the classroom.
meanings.sent4: The sudden scandal threatened to defenestrate the politician from his career.
meanings.sent5: The power struggle led to the inevitable defenestration of the corrupt official.
